steps.title: Landing on the dashboard
details: All tests open http://localhost:5173 without trouble.
First visual impression regularly flagged for dull colours and mis-aligned typography.

steps.title: Creating a task
details: Most flows succeed in opening the “Add New Task” modal and filling fields.
Hard failure in Drag & Move Task: Create Task button could not be clicked because an open category menu intercepted pointer events (Playwright timeout).
Repeated UI review flags: uneven padding, inconsistent button styling, font-size drift.

steps.title: Post-creation feedback
details: Several scripts look for a success toast or for the new task in the list; many times no explicit confirmation is detected.
Test logs resort to scrolling and re-searching the list to verify success.

steps.title: Editing, moving, pinning and favouriting
details: Editing and marking favourite eventually succeed, but scripts need many scrolls and clicks – the controls are hard to spot.
Moving (drag & drop) never executes because the flow stopped at the earlier Create Task failure.
Pin Task scenario stalls at visual verification; no distinct ‘pinned’ icon or list re-ordering is detected.

steps.title: Settings & appearance
details: Theme toggles (Light/Dark/System) work, but Reduce-Motion and Glow-Effect steps remain ‘pending’; tester could not find or confirm them.
Visual consistency issues (padding / margins) dominate the UI review comments.

steps.title: Category management
details: Adding new category ‘Hobby’ fails – no toast, not present in list.
Editing an existing category works, but again takes many clicks; success relies on screenshot confirmation rather than UI feedback.

steps.title: Sharing tasks
details: Copy-link path passes, but confirmation toast is missing or not visible.
QR-code share path: tester can open the tab, but can’t reliably download or verify the QR; final documentation step fails.

steps.title: PWA install
details: Tester cannot find ‘Install App’ – Safari offers no PWA prompt; subsequent standalone-app validations all fail.

steps.title: Purge all tasks
details: Purge flow completes, but success message contains spelling errors (‘taks’, ‘tak’).

emotional_arc: A real shopper would start confident (app loads quickly), feel mild unease from visual rough edges, become frustrated by missing confirmations and click-blocking overlays, experience relief when an action finally works, and end with lingering doubt because several flows (install, new category, drag-and-drop) simply never succeed.

qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Users perceive the app as broken when a visible button won’t respond.
next_actions: Automatically close dropdown / popover menus when focus leaves them or when another primary action button comes into view.
Add z-index audits in CI to ensure modals and menus do not sit above critical buttons.

qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: People need assurance that their action (create, edit, delete, share) actually succeeded.
next_actions: Emit a concise toast (‘Task created’) with auto-dismiss and an ARIA live region.
Show inline state changes immediately (e.g., new task card slides into list, favourite star fills).

qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Inconsistent UI erodes trust and forces users to hunt for meaning instead of flowing through tasks.
next_actions: Adopt a design-token system for font sizes, weights, colours and spacing.
Audit all MuiButton variants – use one size, one corner radius; apply same padding grid to inputs.

qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Misspellings (‘taks’) and vague labels (‘Glow Effect’) undermine professionalism and clarity.
next_actions: Run spell-check across UI strings; add unit test that rejects common typos.
Make action labels outcome-oriented (‘Download QR code’, ‘Install Todo App’).

qualitative_opportunities.area: Discoverability of advanced features (PWA install, reduce motion, share QR)
qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Hidden or non-functional features frustrate power users and inflate support cost.
next_actions: Detect browser PWA support and surface an ‘Install App’ banner only when available.
Populate the share dialog with clear primary + secondary actions; disable or hide QR tab if generator fails.
Group appearance settings under clear headings; grey-out options unavailable on current device.

qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Low contrast and small fonts make the app unusable for many users and risk legal non-compliance.
next_actions: Run automated contrast testing (e.g., axe) in CI; adjust palette.
Increase base font size to 16 px; ensure labels are programmatically associated with inputs.

first_tackles.description: Close any open popover/menu when the user attempts to click the primary modal action (Create Task, Save, etc.) – fixes the hard blocker seen in Drag & Move flow.
Implement universal success toast + ARIA live region for create / edit / delete / share actions.
Standardise spacing and button styles via a shared Mui theme – quick CSS work with high perceived polish.
Spell-check and rewrite key micro-copy (‘tasks’, confirmation messages, menu labels).
Add contrast checks and adjust colour palette to meet AA standards – small tweak, big accessibility win.
